Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a self-slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded, containing an invoice.
Curator's comments: The character of this ostracon is not certain, owing to its brevity. It may conceivably be a receipt without a date; but it seems unlikely that receipts, except by an accident, would be issued without a date, and on the whole it is most probable that it was a note of the destination and, in most cases, nature and amount, of a consignment, sent with it as a check on full delivery. It mentions the same place as 1923,0327.104 (O.Sarga 195).
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.151-2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87674) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87674)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 194 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
